nationalcaps1 = 20 | nationalgoals1 = 3 | club-update = 21:50, 22 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 18 November 2018 }} '''David Wayne "Junior" Hoilett''' (born 5 June 1990) is a Canadian professional [[association football]] player who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] and the [[CMNT|Canadian national team]].
He signed for English club [[Blackburn Rovers]] at the age of 13, and was loaned to [[SC Paderborn 07|SC Paderborn]] and [[FC St. Pauli]] in the German [[2. Bundesliga]]. He made his Rovers debut in 2009 and played three full [[Premier League]] seasons for them before a transfer to [[Queens Park Rangers]]. Hoilett spent four years at the [[Loftus Road]] club – alternately in the Premier League and [[EFL Championship|Championship]] – before moving to Cardiff on the expiration of his contract.
Hoilett made his senior international debut for [[Canada men's national soccer team|Canada]] in 2015. He was part of their squad at the [[2017 CONCACAF Gold Cup]].
==Club career==
===Blackburn Rovers Academy=== Hoilett was born in [[Brampton]], [[Ontario]], and played several sports as a child before settling on football at age 11.<ref name=lancs>{{cite news |last1=Cryer |first1=Andy |title=Hoilett: I've made it at Blackburn Rovers the hard way |url=https://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/5046588.hoilett-ive-made-it-at-blackburn-rovers-the-hard-way/ |accessdate=22 January 2019 |work=Lancashire Telegraph |date=8 March 2010}}</ref> In the same year, he travelled the world with his club and gained attention at a tournament in Wales; he turned down [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] for [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] as he believed he had more chance of breaking into the first team at the latter.<ref name=lancs/> After moving to England, he attended [[St Bede's Roman Catholic High School, Blackburn|St Bede's Roman Catholic High School]] in [[Blackburn]].<ref name=lancs/><ref>{{cite news |title=Premier League Under 16 Schools’ Cup for Girls’ Final |url=http://www.esfa.co.uk/news/?2015/04/28/094110/premier-league-under-16-schools-cup-for-girls-final |accessdate=22 January 2019 |publisher=English Schools Football Association |date=28 April 2015}}</ref> As he was initially unable to earn a work permit to play in the United Kingdom, Blackburn loaned him to German clubs to help him earn one in the future.<ref name=lancs/>
====SC Paderborn (loan)==== Hoilett made his debut for [[SC Paderborn 07|SC Paderborn]] (on [[loan (sports)|loan]]) against [[Kickers Offenbach]], coming on as a [[substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Sven Lintjens]] in a 3–2 victory on 3 February 2008, aged 17.<ref name="Zwei Aussetzer in der Defensive">{{cite news | title = Zwei Aussetzer in der Defensive | url = http://www.scpaderborn07.de/scpaderborn07/2-Home/3698,Zwei-Aussetzer-in-der-Defensive.html | publisher = SC Paderborn | date = 3 February 2008 | language = German | accessdate =27 March 2008}}</ref> Hoilett's first match in the starting eleven was against [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|1899 Hoffenheim]] on 9 March 2008.<ref name="Beste Torchancen vergeben">{{cite news|title=Beste Torchancen vergeben |url=http://www.scpaderborn07.de/scpaderborn07/38-Saison/3820,Beste-Torchancen-vergeben.html |language=German |publisher=SC Paderborn |date= |accessdate=27 March 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110719083808/http://www.scpaderborn07.de/scpaderborn07/38-Saison/3820%2CBeste-Torchancen-vergeben.html |archivedate=19 July 2011 |df= }}</ref>
Hoilett scored his only goal of his loan campaign on 18 May 2008 against [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Paderborn vs. Borussia M'gladbach 2 – 3|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2008/05/18/germany/2-bundesliga/sc-paderborn-07-ev/borussia-monchengladbach/470135/|publisher=SoccerWay.com|accessdate=31 January 2012|date=18 May 2008}}</ref> in what would be his final game for the club.
Paderborn were later relegated, ending the [[2007–08 2. Bundesliga]] season in 17th position.<ref>{{cite web|title=Germany 2007/08|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tablesd/duit08.html|publisher=rsssf.com|accessdate=31 January 2012}}</ref>
====FC St. Pauli (loan)==== Hoilett was loaned to another German club in the [[2. Bundesliga]], [[FC St. Pauli]], for the [[2008–09 2. Bundesliga]] season. He made his debut for the [[Hamburg]]-based side against [[SpVgg Greuther Fürth]] on 22 August 2008. He scored six times during his loan campaign with braces against [[Alemannia Aachen]] and [[F.C. Hansa Rostock|Hansa Rostock]], as well as individual goals against [[TSV 1860 München|1860 München]] and [[1. FC Kaiserslautern]]. His final game would come in the form of a 1–0 loss against [[Rot Weiss Ahlen]] on 3 May 2009. St. Pauli finished the season in eighth position.<ref>{{cite web|title=Germany 2008/09|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tablesd/duit09.html|publisher=rsssf.com|accessdate=31 January 2012}}</ref>
===Blackburn Rovers=== In January 2009, Hoilett's home club Blackburn applied for him to receive a [[work permit]] for him to play football in England.<ref name="Hoilett Fight For Work Permit">{{cite news | title = Teen ace in permit fight | first = Andy | last = Cryer | url = http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/search/4427012.Teen_ace_in_permit_fight/ | publisher = Lancashire Telegraph | date = 9 June 2009 | accessdate = 14 June 2009}}</ref> In the summer of 2009, Hoilett was granted a work permit on appeal, allowing him to continue his fledgling career in England at the [[Premier League]] level with Blackburn.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/2bundesliga/startseite/artikel/511053/ | title = Hoilett zurück auf der Insel | language = German | publisher = kicker.de | accessdate = 9 July 2012 | date = 6 July 2009}}</ref>
[[File:Junior Hoilett.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Hoilett before the match between Blackburn and Arsenal at Ewood Park on September 17, 2011]]
He scored his first and second goals for Blackburn since his full-time return to the club in only his third game, in a pre-season friendly against non-League club [[Leigh Genesis F.C.|Leigh Genesis]]. He also earned Rovers a penalty in that game. His first competitive goal for Rovers came in a 3–1 [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] win at [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]] on 25 August 2009.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/8203195.stm |title=Gillingham 1 – 3 Blackburn |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 August 2009 |accessdate=26 August 2009}}</ref>
Hoilett was involved in Blackburn's dramatic [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] win against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 2 December 2009. Coming on as a second half substitution, he won an extra-time penalty which [[Benni McCarthy]] converted to put Rovers 3–2 up, but then missed a golden chance late on to seal victory before [[Paulo Ferreira]] equalised in the 122nd minute. However, Hoilett converted the crucial fifth penalty to help Rovers to the 4–3 shootout win and a place in the semi-finals. He then started his first league match on 12 December 2009 against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]], playing the full 90 minutes in a 0–0 draw at the [[KC Stadium]]. On 25 February 2010, with his contract due to expire in June 2010, Hoilett ended media speculation regarding his future at the club, by signing a new two-and-a-half year deal with Blackburn, keeping him at the club until the summer of 2012. On 9 May, he scored a header in a win over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] at [[Villa Park]] on the final day of the season, although the goal was later recorded as a [[Richard Dunne]] own goal. Hoilett made his first Premier League appearance of the [[2010–11 Premier League|2010–11 season]] on 21 August 2010 by coming on for [[Nikola Kalinić]] in the 84th minute in a 2–1 defeat at [[St Andrew's (stadium)|St Andrew's]] against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.rovers.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10303~1976874,00.html | title = Junior agrees new deal | publisher = Blackburn Rovers | date = 25 February 2010 | accessdate = 9 July 2012 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20120329034014/http://www.rovers.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10303~1976874,00.html | archive-date = 29 March 2012 | dead-url = yes | df = dmy-all }}</ref>
He scored his first goal of the 2010–11 season in the 1–0 victory over [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] in the [[FA Cup]] third round.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rovers.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10303~54887,00.html |title=Junior scores 1st 2010/11 season goal vs QPR |publisher=Blackburn Rovers |accessdate=9 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111014225535/http://www.rovers.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10303~54887%2C00.html |archivedate=14 October 2011 |df= }}</ref>
Hoilett scored his first league goal on 23 January 2011 in a 2–0 home victory against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] at [[Ewood Park]], converting in the 47th minute from a Nikola Kalinić assist. On 12 February 2011, he made his 40th Premier League appearance for Blackburn when he featured against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] at Ewood Park in a goalless draw, and was replaced at half-time due to a slight hamstring strain by [[Morten Gamst Pedersen]]. On 5 March, he scored his third goal of the season in a 3–2 defeat against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in the 65th minute, away at [[Craven Cottage]]. He replaced by debutant [[Rubén Rochina]] on 82 minutes. His next goal came in the following game, a last gasp equaliser coming from a header against [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] at Ewood Park in a 2–2 draw. On 9 April 2011, he scored in the 1–1 draw versus Birmingham City at Ewood Park on half-time, but he unfortunately got injured in the 68th minute, being replaced by Australian [[Brett Emerton]].
He scored his fifth league goal of the season with an individual goal, in a 3–2 win against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] at [[Molineux Stadium]] on the last day of the season. On 11 September 2011, in a game between Blackburn and [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], he was involved in a collision with [[Mark Schwarzer]] which resulted a head injury for Hoilett. He was eventually stretched off and Schwarzer received a yellow card. Hoilett scored a controversial second's goal in a match as Blackburn drew with [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] 3–3 after teammate Morten Gamst Pedersen seemed to dribble the ball straight from a corner before firing in a low cross for Hoilett to head home from two yards.<ref name="3 Wigan–3 Blackburn">{{cite news | title = Wigan 3–3 Blackburn | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/15704787.stm | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 19 November 2011 | accessdate =19 November 2011}}</ref>
In January 2012, Hoilett was named one of the 13 players to watch in 2012 by world football governing body [[FIFA]].<ref name="fifa-2012-01-13">{{cite news | title = Players to watch in 2012 | url = https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1567609.html | publisher = FIFA | date = 13 January 2012 | accessdate =17 February 2012}}</ref>
In the [[2011–12 Premier League|2011–12 season]], Hoilett had the most dribbles per game among all Premier League players.<ref name="whoscored-2011-2012">{{cite news | title = Player Statistics Rankings of Premier League (2011/2012) | url = http://www.whoscored.com/Regions/252/Tournaments/2/Seasons/2935/Stages/5476/PlayerStatistics/England-Premier-League-2011-2012 | publisher = WhoScored.com | date = 10 May 2012 | accessdate = 2 January 2013}}</ref>
===Queens Park Rangers=== [[File:Chelsea 2 QPR 1 (15500879198).jpg|thumb|left|Hoilett (in white) playing against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in November 2014]] After refusing a contract renewal with Blackburn Rovers, Hoilett joined Queens Park Rangers on 27 July 2012 for a fee decided by tribunal. He signed a four-year contract.<ref>{{cite news|title=Junior joins R's revolution |url=http://www.qpr.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10373~2858641,00.html |publisher=QPR |date=27 July 2012 |accessdate=27 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120729200136/http://www.qpr.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10373~2858641%2C00.html |archivedate=29 July 2012 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19015967|title= Junior Hoilett joins Queens Park Rangers from Blackburn Rovers | date= 27 July 2012}}</ref> He scored his first goal for QPR in a 3–2 [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] defeat to [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on 26 September 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19645187 |title=QPR 2–3 Reading |publisher=[[BBC]] |date=26 September 2012 |accessdate=28 September 2012}}</ref> On 2 March 2013, Hoilett set-up teammate [[Loïc Rémy]] and played a crucial part in a 2–1 win over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21556942|title=Southampton 1–2 QPR |publisher= [[BBC]] |date=2 March 2013 |accessdate=23 February 2014}}</ref> A combination of injuries and poor form meant that Hoilett had a frustrating first season at QPR, which resulted in relegation to the [[Football League Championship]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Reading v QPR|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/283166/report|accessdate=10 December 2014|date=28 April 2013}}</ref>
Hoilett scored his first goal of the [[2013–14 Football League Championship]] season in a 1–1 draw with [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23558561|title=Huddersfield 1–1 QPR |publisher= [[BBC]] |date=10 August 2013 |accessdate=23 February 2014}}</ref> Four months later, he scored his second goal of the season in a comfortable 3–0 win over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] at [[Loftus Road]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25098375|title=QPR 3–0 Bournemouth |publisher= [[BBC]] |date=3 December 2013 |accessdate=24 February 2014}}</ref> Hoilett grabbed an assist for the only goal of the game, when he crossed for [[Bobby Zamora]] to score in the 89th minute in QPR's 1–0 victory over [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] at [[Wembley Stadium]] in the [[2014 Football League Championship play-off Final]] to gain promotion back to the Premier League after an absence of one season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ibtimes.com/video-qpr-1-0-derby-highlights-zamora-goal-wins-championship-play-final-dramatic-fashion-1589812|title=VIDEO: QPR 1–0 Derby: Highlights; Zamora Goal Wins Championship Play-Off Final In Dramatic Fashion|publisher=[[International Business Times]]|date=24 May 2014|accessdate=27 May 2014}}</ref> After failing to agree a new contract with QPR at the end of the 2015–16 season, Hoilett left the club following the expiry of his contract.<ref name=Bluebirds>{{cite web|title=Cardiff City boss Neil Warnock signs Junior Hoilett as he immediately bolsters his Bluebirds team|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-boss-neil-warnock-11989349|publisher=WalesOnline|accessdate=6 October 2016}}</ref>
===Cardiff City=== Following the appointment of [[Neil Warnock]] as manager, Hoilett signed with [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on 6 October 2016, becoming Warnock's first signing at the club.<ref name=Bluebirds/> His debut came on 14 October, against severnside rivals, [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 2–1 Bristol City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37581994 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 October 2016 |accessdate=14 October 2016}}</ref> Hoilett scored his first goal for Cardiff during a 3–2 victory over [[Huddersfield Town F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on 19 November 2016.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37958534 |title=Cardiff 3-2 Huddersfield |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=19 November 2016 |accessdate=21 November 2016}}</ref> He went on to score one more goal before signing a one-year contract extension in May 2017.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40174267 |title=Cardiff City: Bluebirds contract extensions for Hoilett and Peltier |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 June 2017 |accessdate=10 June 2017}}</ref>
The [[2017–18 Football League Championship|2017–18 season]] saw Hoilett's most productive season, finishing the season with 12 goals, including goals against former club, [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] and a brace against [[Mansfield Town F.C.|Mansfield Town]] in the [[FA Cup]], as Cardiff finished 2nd, gaining promotion to the [[Premier League]].<ref>{{soccerbase|52010|2017}}</ref> Hoilett was offered a new contract following the club promotion.<ref>{{cite news |title=Junior Hoilett: Cardiff City future unclear |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44486045 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 June 2018 |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref>
On 26 June 2018, Hoilett signed a three-year contract in the Welsh capital.<ref>{{cite news |title=Junior Hoilett: Winger signs new Cardiff City contract |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44614641 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 June 2018 |accessdate=26 June 2018}}</ref> He scored his first [[Premier League]] goal since 2012 in a 2–1 win over [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on 30 November, which BBC Sport called a "fabulous first-time effort from 25 yards".<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 2–1 Wolves |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46312729 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 November 2018 |accessdate=2 December 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Hoilett was born in [[Brampton]], [[Ontario]]. As a child, he captained Canada's representative team at the 2001 [[Danone Nations Cup]] in [[Paris]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Danone Nations Cup Alumni |url=http://www.coupedanonecup.com/alumni.aspx |publisher=CoupeDanoneCup |accessdate=12 March 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120314230927/http://www.coupedanonecup.com/alumni.aspx |archivedate=14 March 2012 |df=dmy }}</ref>
Hoilett was eligible to play for [[Canada men's national soccer team|Canada]] or [[Jamaica national football team|Jamaica]] at international level.<ref name="fifa-2012-01-13"/> In February 2011, he rejected a call-up from the Canadian national team, stating that he wanted more time to develop his club career before committing to international football.<ref>{{cite web|title=Hoilett absent from Canadian soccer squad|url=http://www.cbc.ca/sports/soccer/story/2011/02/03/sp-canada-greece.html | first = John F. | last = Molinaro |publisher=CBC.ca|accessdate=6 February 2012 | date = 3 February 2011}}</ref> In January 2012, [[Jamaica Football Federation]] president [[Horace Burrell]] confirmed that he had approached the player's father about Hoilett representing Jamaica.<ref name="gleaner-2012-2-6">{{cite web|last=Wright|first=Nodley|title=New Boyz coming|url=http://jamaica-gleaner.com/gleaner/20120129/sports/sports1.html|publisher=Jamaica Gleaner|accessdate=6 February 2012}}</ref> In March 2012, Hoilett told various media bodies that he would consider playing for [[England national football team|England]] if eligible.<ref>{{cite web|title=Hoilett – togetherness is key|url=http://www.skysports.com/video/inline/0,,16426_7585399,00.html|publisher=SkySports.com|accessdate=12 March 2012|date=10 March 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Premier League and Football League latest scores and results|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17308534|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=12 March 2012|date=10 March 2012}}</ref>
Hoilett officially declared for Canada in September 2015, prior to the [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – CONCACAF Fourth Round|fourth round of CONCACAF 2018 World Cup Qualifying]].<ref name="commits to Canada">{{cite web|title=Junior Hoilett commits to Canada Soccer|url=http://www.thespec.com/sports-story/5938311-junior-hoilett-commits-to-canada-soccer/|publisher=Hamilton Spectator|accessdate=30 September 2015}}</ref> He received his first international cap in a 1–1 draw against [[Ghana national football team|Ghana]] on 13 October 2015 at [[Robert F. Kennedy Memorial Stadium|RFK Stadium]] in [[Washington, D.C.]]<ref name="Canada MNT deliver impressive performance in Ghana draw">{{cite web|title=Canada MNT deliver impressive performance in Ghana draw|url=http://www.canadasoccer.com/-canada-mnt-deliver-impressive-performance-in-ghana-draw-p158721|publisher=Canada Soccer|accessdate=14 October 2015}}</ref> He officially got cap-tied to Canada after starting for Canada in a 2018 World Cup Qualification match against [[Honduras national football team|Honduras]]. Hoilett was named to Canada's squad for the [[2017 CONCACAF Gold Cup]] on June 27, 2017,<ref>{{cite web|first=Dave|last=Zeitlin|url=https://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2017/06/27/canada-names-nine-mls-players-23-man-concacaf-gold-cup-roster|title=Canada names nine MLS players to 23-man CONCACAF Gold Cup roster|date=June 27, 2017}}</ref> and scored his first international goal in the quarterfinal, a 2–1 defeat to eventual finalists [[Jamaica national football team|Jamaica]] on July 20.<ref>{{cite web|first=Gavin|last=Day|url=http://www.cbc.ca/sports/soccer/gold-cup-canada-out-jamaica-strikes-early-1.4214890|title=Canada out of Gold Cup as Jamaica strikes quickly|date=July 20, 2017}}</ref>
==Personal life== Hoilett's parents are of Jamaican descent;<ref name=lancs/> his father hails from [[Ocho Rios]] in Jamaica.<ref name="gleaner-2012-2-6"/> Hoilett's brother is Canada U-20 international Jaineil Hoilett.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.canadasoccer.com/players/profile.asp?playerid=1677&gender=male | title =Jaineil Hoilett Profile | publisher = Canadasoccer.com}}{{Dead link|date=July 2012}}</ref> who represented Canada at the [[2009 CONCACAF U-17 Championship]] and Canada's U-20 team against the United States in December 2010.<ref>{{cite web|title=U.S. U-20 Men's National Team tops Canada 2–0 in friendly in Florida|url=http://www.nationalsoccerwire.com/news/458/12563|publisher=National Soccer Wire|accessdate=12 March 2012|date=18 December 2010}}</ref>
